sentences.sContent: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.sCn: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.sContent: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.sCn: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

sentences.sContent: ...The reality of it is that a lot of low-income kids could be going to elite universities on a full ride scholarship and don't even realize it...
...You claim you are traveling on a scholarship from Delhi University...
...your teacher could jeopardize a student's chance of getting a scholarship or getting into a top college...

words.tran: 博学的；勤奋好学的；学术的

trans.tranOther: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education
